p: Favipiravir (FPV) may be one of the possible treatment options for COVID-19 [ 109]. It has been shown that FPV is able to inhibit virus reproduction in vitro. Preliminary studies comparing favipiravir treatment with lopinavir/ritonavir reported shorter viremic clearance (4 vs. 11 days) and improved radiological picture in the FPV group [ 110]. Irie et al. investigated the pharmacokinetics of FPV in the context of COVID-19 treatment showed that the drug concentration was lower in critically ill patients compared to healthy individuals, indicating the need for using higher doses [ 111]. Lack of more accurate data requires in-depth research in this area.
